alert.note: Alert for Northern Gila County; Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 21 at 9:06PM MST until March 22 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: .Heavy rain continues to fall across the region with some of the rain falling on snow. This is leading to increased flows in waterways. Several creeks and waterways have reached critical levels. Additional rises in river, creek, and stream levels are expected. Be aware that Flood Warnings and Advisories are in effect for portions of central and northern Arizona. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues to be possible with some areas currently experiencing flooding in Yavapai County and northern Gila County. * WHERE...Portions of central and northern Arizona, including northern Gila County and Yavapai County. * WHEN...Through Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...Flash flooding will be possible in creeks, normally dry washes, swimming holes and over recently burned areas. Low-water crossings could also experience flash flooding, which would create deadly travel conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Ample moisture and widespread, continuous rain and snow along the Mogollon Rim and southward have led to increased runoff. Waterways continue to experience elevated flows. Rain on snow has also contributed to elevated flows and the risk of flooding. These conditions will remain through Wednesday afternoon with flooding possible through Wednesday evening. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings and Advisories. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Northern Gila County; Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins
